reviews.review_msg: She will assign a minimum of seven readings per lecture. She is very vocal towards students who are disruptive during class. The TA literally saved this course.
Don't be disruptive in class and listen in lecture very well. Always communicate with the prof and the TAs if you need help.

This is his grading scale! What a nut. If his profs gave grades like this he wouldn't be a Phd. Avoid at all costs.                                                           A+ 97-100
 A 94-96
 A- 90-93
 B+ 87-89
 B 84-86
 B- 80-83
 C+ 77-79
 C 74-76
 C- 70-73
No Comments

This guy is not good. Final Exam: 4 essays, 3 hours. I understand his concept of 'pick your readings' but he wasn't balanced. He didn't stick the weekly readings, always babbling about Nukes or McNamara. Avoid his class.
Grahn is pretty bad, mostly because he lacks experience.  He also sounds like the teacher from South Park when he, at the end of his sentences, says "m'kay" instead of "okay".

I'm a poli sci major and I really hate this guy! Over 50 readings throughout the semester all of which were long and grueling to read; mixed w/  lecture notes! Won't tell you what to know for final-Out to make the class fail-really needs to learn how to teach-Such interesting material gone to waste!
No Comments

First time teaching this class and needs some work. However, his supplementary material is definitely thought provoking, and he clearly knows his stuff. A lot of people probably aren't polisci majors who took the class and were looking for an easy mark, but this guy is demanding but fair.

This guy needs to go to seminars on how to teach effectively in University! Very hard to get a hole of, totally unsupportive, definate lack of care. Reduce the amount of readings, so people can actually make sense of what the jist of the course is!  Horrible professor, with an ego to boot.VERY BAD!

His lectures are badly organized, with little link between reading material and lectures.  He focuses too much on the detail while missing the big pcture.  A good/smart guy, but not a very good professor.
he's a good prof. easy taking notes in his lectures, the stuff is pretty straight forward, except when he puts those really small overheads. overall he's ok.

A really kind and good professor, but tests are very hard and confusing. The tests are reading heavy so if u dont read EVERY reading youre done for. A multiple choice question will be like: what was the main thesis _____'s paper? then u have to choose between 4 identical answers with a few words changed :.) i cried after the final exam.
Bro may be Japanese but speaks a lot of Yappanese
Funny guy

Has difficulty explaining simple concepts and goes on long tangents that leaves student questions unanswered, lectures are often long and difficult to follow. HIs grading scheme is inconsistent and his criteria for assignments will change without him informing the class. Generally seems understanding and caring but still a very tough marker overall

The lectures and readings are scattered and unclear. The exam cheat sheet he gives you for the final is again all over the place, and the questions that are presented are absurd. A very nice man, who is great help during his office hours, but just does a terrible job teaching and structuring the course.

Worst class I have ever taken. While Prof. Ross is a fantastic academic and clearly knows his material, the delivery of his lectures, the wide breadth of content assigned in weekly readings (interesting but scattered) and the overall disorganization of the class make it utterly terrible. The Syllabus had 2 sentence description for a 40% paper.

Ross is very interesting and knowledgeable but his lectures consist of long rants and are very disorganized. Make sure you read all of the readings because that's whats being tested not his rants in class. There are movies in lecture every class that are interesting. A hard final exam, but overall the class was enjoyable despite its shortcomings.

He's a really interesting prof, and clearly brilliant, but his lectures are a little bit chaotic and hard to follow/take notes on. I loved the readings and they never felt like work, but I wish this had been a seminar, because I feel like he'd be awesome to have as a seminar prof.

Overall it was a decent class. However the tutorials were much more useful than the lectures. The lectures were often off topic and turned into him ranting about random subjects. I admit I missed a few of them but still got a decent grade. However, I don't think I would take another class with him. Turns an interesting subject into something boring

Teaching style does not do favours for this class There is literally no structure for his lectures and they are essentially long rants This does not adequately prepare you at all for the final so you have to end up teaching yourself all the material through the textbook. You need to be a military historian to do well Would not take this class again
Seriously rather would watch the news on TV instead of going to his class. Utterly pointless really.

He is a lovely man, however, his teaching style leaves a lot to be desired.  His lecture consists of a self-talk about current events, followed by a Hollywood film and then a half hour seminar discussion, on which your participation grade is determined (80 kids in the class- kind of makes it hard). A real shame that this course is taught so poorly.

He, and I suppose the TA as well, suspected I plagarized (I am a good writer and put lot's of effort into my papers) so he deducted massive points for an inconsequential oversight. I had to confront him to get my grade back. It's not like I haven't experienced that type of behavior directed towards me before.

This course has far too much potential to be taught in this manner. A two-hour movie in every three hour lecture left no time for him to teach. He consistenly returned graded papers in an untimely fashion and could not even report the final grades on time. I would wholeheartedly recommend the department find someone else to teach this course.

Awesome Prof! Great sense of humour; extremely knowledgeable; very interesting lecturer.  Does not spend much time reviewing text material (it is a 300-level course after all), but instead reviews current events and screens relevant films. Best TA (Lidia) I have ever had. Challenging but worthwhile. Course material was fascinating! Lots of writing.

Every class he shows a film. The material is very interesting as he has selected highly relevant readings. There is a disconnect between the films and the final exam, so make sure to do the readings! It really isn't necessary to take notes during the films; the exam is based on readings and notes.
Excellent professor. Learned so much new concepts.
He does not even lecture. He rambles for about 1/2 hour each class and you do not even know what is important. Way too much expected for the final exam.

Have you ever been dragged to a movie you didn't want to go to? And sat next to an annoying friend who never shut up the whole time? Well multiply that by 100 and you have some idea of what this man's teaching style is like.
avoid

One of the worst profs. i've ever had, so random with his wasteful lectures and holywood movies..i thought this class would be so good, i couldn't have been more wrong. the quizs are so insane and the final exam was so hard for only 20%!!!

Very disorganized.Wastes precious lecture time on Hollywood films instead of lecturing on material read in texts. This indicates that he is unwilling to put in the time for creating an organized and coherent set of lectures.Final exam is unreasonable for 20% (3 essays and 10 concepts). 600 spent on watching films that I have seen. Do not recommend!

Appears to put very little effort into class; Quizes difficult and final totally unreasonable (10 concepts and 3 essays for a final worth 20%??). While he shows interest in subject material, he is clearly not capable of teaching it.
He's big into nukes, missiles, doomsday predictions and all that cool stuff.
Brought the subject matter home.
Very good, one of the best profs. I have ever had.  Very clear and lectures are always interesting.  I would highly recommend!!
